text: Hi. I'm talking about HubSpot form.  I check checkbox with javascript but when I type a email in the email field all checkboxes are unchecked. I saw that "input.hs_context" is changed when I enter a letter in the email field. I've tried to modify the "input.hs_context" value (by inserting a "formValidity" key with the name of my field and "{"value" : true}"), by the context value is always changed when I enter an email address (in a private session with chrome). What can I do to keep my checkbox checked when I enter an email address please?
How can I do this in pure Javascript? `$('input[name="firstname"]').val("damiano").change();`
My form is on a module on a HubSpot portal.
Fixed. Instead of `myInputRadioEelement.checked = true` I have to write `myInputRadioEelement.click()` in pure javascript.
